result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy G Grueneberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Amend JOC per letter filed on 5-31-16 regarding sentence credit.  Per Judge White
Letter, with attachments, from Records Supervisor at Stanley Correctional Institution requesting the Court to review the sentence credit granted on the March 16, 2016 JOC
March 16, 2016 hearing filed by Court Reporter Chris Champeau
Order to amend JOC to show probation term of 1 year.
Letter from Janelle Nehring, DOC Offender Registrar, requesting clarification of the probationary term ordered  for Count 2
Filed by District Attorney Jane Kohlwey
Filed by Atty Mark Lawton
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment filed by attorny Mark Lawton

Defendant Jeremy G Grueneberg in court, in custody with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing recommendations given by State and attorney Lawton.  Defendant made statement.  Court sentenced defendant on Ct. 1 to serve 7 years in prison, consecutive to previously imposed sentence. 4 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervison.  Ct. 2 court witheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 2 years, consecutive to all other sentences including Ct. 1.  Conditions of extended supervison/probation include: AODA and comply.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No contact with S.J., his family, their residence, or work places.  Maintain full time employment or seek employment.  Not go on premises where alcohol is sold for on site consumption.  59 days jail credit. Ct. 1 $518.00 costs.  Ct. 2 $243.00 costs.  11:00/11:35
Filed by Atty Mark Lawton - Alternate PSI
Filed by Agent Ashley Tassoul
with Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus to Stanley Correctional for March 16, 2016
Per Stanley Correctional, the number to call to connect Mr. Grueneberg for the sentencing hearing, if appearing by telephone, is 715-644-2960, ext. 3435.
Sentencing hearing at 03-16-2016 11:00 am
Filed by Atty Mark Lawton

Defendant Jeremy G Grueneberg in court, in custody with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 1&2. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Pre-sentence Investigation ordered.
